title: Iceland's Geothermal Success Story Inspires Global Adoption
introText: Iceland now generates 100% of its electricity from renewable sources, with geothermal providing the baseload. Other nations are studying the model for application in volcanic regions worldwide.

content.content: Iceland generates 100% of electricity from renewables: 70% hydro and 30% geothermal. The country also heats 90% of homes directly with geothermal hot water.
Cheap, abundant power has attracted energy-intensive industries like aluminum smelting and data centers. Iceland's energy independence shields the economy from fossil fuel price volatility.

Countries along the Pacific Ring of Fireâ€”Indonesia, Philippines, Japanâ€”are expanding geothermal development based on Iceland's example. New drilling technologies make previously inaccessible resources viable.

summary: Iceland generates 100% of its electricity from renewables, with geothermal leading the way, inspiring global adoption in volcanic regions.
